of force being applied to a particular
area at any point in a contained fluid
an equal increase in pressure is exerted
at every other point in the container
Blaise Pascal a French mathematician
figured this out in 1646 by pouring
water down a pipe into a wooden barrel
that was already full instead of the
water just running up out of the top of
the pipe as you might expect the barrel
exploded the weight of the water being
poured in in
the pressure on all sides of the barrel

well that's where another important law

this states the amount of pressure and
